title: Adventure Game Project
description: A template for story-driven adventure games with exploration, puzzles, dialogue, and narrative progression. Includes pipelines for locations, characters, puzzles, and story beats.

tags.description: Bug or defect that needs fixing

decks.name: Locations
decks.description: Explorable areas and scenes. Add a location card, start its journey to build it.

cards.content:
Starting Village

The peaceful hometown where the adventure begins.

**Act:** Act 1
**Exits:** Forest Path (north), Player's House (east)
**NPCs:** 5-7 villagers with dialogue
**Key Events:** Meet mentor, receive quest, learn basic mechanics

This card uses **#act-1** and **#main-path** tags. Use act tags to organize narrative progression and path tags to distinguish critical vs optional content.

> **Sub-Cards:** These were created by the journey! Each location needs art, coding for interactions, dialogue writing, and audio ambiance.

Ancient Temple

A mysterious ruin hiding secrets.

**Act:** Act 2
**Contains:** 3 puzzle rooms, hidden treasure
**Atmosphere:** Dark, mysterious, slightly dangerous
**Purpose:** Optional dungeon for side quest

decks.name: Characters
decks.description: NPCs and companions with dialogue and personality. Add a character card, start its journey.

cards.content:
The Mentor

Wise old guide who sets you on your quest.

**Role:** Tutorial NPC, quest giver
**Personality:** Patient, mysterious, knows more than they say
**Appears In:** Starting Village, Act 1 finale
**Key Dialogue:** 3-4 conversations throughout Act 1

> **Priority:** This is marked 'a' priority because tutorial characters are critical for onboarding players!

Quirky Shopkeeper

Comic relief merchant who sells items.

**Role:** Shop vendor, provides hints for secrets
**Personality:** Cheerful, greedy, friendly
**Appears In:** Multiple locations throughout game
**Special:** Remembers previous purchases in dialogue

**Effort Note:** This has 3 effort - simpler than major story characters but still needs personality!

Character 3

Another NPC. Define their role and personality.

Color Crystal Puzzle

Match colored crystals to open a door.

**Location:** Ancient Temple
**Mechanic:** Rotate crystals until all match target pattern
**Difficulty:** Medium
**Hint System:** NPC nearby can give clues if player is stuck

**Linked Location:** Ancient Temple

decks.name: Story Beats
decks.description: Major narrative moments and cutscenes. These are unique events, not repeatable assets.

cards.content:
Opening Cutscene

Introduces the world and inciting incident.

**Type:** Non-interactive cutscene
**Length:** 2-3 minutes
**Purpose:** Set tone, introduce protagonist, show problem
**Technical:** May use in-engine cinematics or pre-rendered video

**Story beats are unique, so this deck doesn't use journeys.** Create custom sub-cards for each beat's specific needs (storyboarding, voice recording, animation, etc.).

Act 1 Finale: Village Attack

Climactic event forcing the hero to leave home.

**Type:** Interactive sequence
**Gameplay:** Defend villagers, make moral choice
**Outcome:** Village destroyed, mentor dies/leaves
**Emotion:** Loss, determination

**Branches:** Player choice affects Act 2 dialogue

decks.name: Design Notes
decks.description: Design documentation, meeting notes, and playtesting findings. Use this deck to capture design decisions and their rationale.

cards.content:
Design Meeting: Narrative Pacing

**Date:** Week 2
**Attendees:** Writer, Lead Designer

**Decisions:**
- Story beats will be gated by exploration, not combat
- Player choices should affect character relationships, not plot outcomes
- Environmental storytelling takes priority over exposition

**Rationale:** We want players to feel immersed in the world without being lectured.

Playtesting Notes: Puzzle Difficulty

**Session:** Week 4 playtest
**Issues:**
- 40% of players stuck on the water puzzle for >10 minutes
- Most didn't notice the visual clue in the mural

**Changes Made:** Added subtle audio cue, made mural slightly brighter.
